name: Art Types
description: Various styles and genres of art

subcategories.name: Realism
subcategories.description: Artistic style that aims to represent subject matter truthfully, without artificiality or exaggeration.

subcategories.name: Surrealism
subcategories.description: Artistic movement that explores dreams, the unconscious mind, and the juxtaposition of unlikely elements.

subcategories.name: Modernism
subcategories.description: Artistic movement that rejected traditional forms and experimented with new techniques, materials, and subjects.

subcategories.name: Impressionism
subcategories.description: Artistic movement characterized by visible brush strokes, emphasis on light and its changing qualities, and ordinary subject matter.

subcategories.name: Romanticism
subcategories.description: Artistic movement emphasizing emotion, imagination, and the beauty of nature, often with a focus on the sublime and exotic.

subcategories.name: Expressionism
subcategories.description: Artistic style that emphasizes the expression of inner experience over objective depiction of reality, often through distortion and vivid color.

subcategories.name: Psychedelic Art
subcategories.description: Artistic style inspired by psychedelic experiences, often characterized by surreal imagery, vibrant colors, and intricate patterns.

subcategories.name: Postmodernism
subcategories.description: Artistic movement characterized by skepticism, irony, and a questioning of grand narratives and traditional conventions.

subcategories.name: Hyperrealism
subcategories.description: Artistic style that resembles high-resolution photography, often depicting everyday objects or scenes with extraordinary detail.

subcategories.name: Fantasy
subcategories.description: Artistic genre that explores imaginative and fantastical themes, often involving magic, mythical creatures, and supernatural elements.

subcategories.name: Cyberpunk
subcategories.description: Artistic style that combines futuristic elements with a gritty, dystopian atmosphere, often exploring themes of technology, society, and identity.

subcategories.name: Minimalism
subcategories.description: Artistic style characterized by simplicity, austerity, and an emphasis on form and function over ornamentation.

subcategories.name: Pop Art
subcategories.description: Artistic movement that draws inspiration from popular culture and mass media, often using bold colors and imagery.

subcategories.name: Folk Art
subcategories.description: Artistic tradition passed down through generations within a particular culture, often reflecting cultural beliefs, rituals, and customs.

subcategories.name: Retro
subcategories.description: Artistic style inspired by past decades or nostalgic aesthetics, often characterized by vintage design elements and motifs.

subcategories.name: Abstract
subcategories.description: Artistic style that does not attempt to represent external reality, focusing instead on shapes, colors, and forms.

subcategories.name: Fauvism
subcategories.description: Artistic movement characterized by vibrant colors, bold brushwork, and simplified forms, often depicting scenes with intense emotional expression.

subcategories.name: Art Nouveau
subcategories.description: Artistic style characterized by flowing lines, organic forms, and decorative motifs inspired by nature and natural forms.

subcategories.name: Arabesque
subcategories.description: Artistic motif characterized by intricate, interlaced designs often inspired by Islamic art and architecture.

subcategories.name: Vintage boho
subcategories.description: Artistic style blending vintage aesthetics with bohemian influences, often characterized by eclectic and free-spirited design elements.

subcategories.name: Anime
subcategories.description: Artistic style originating from Japan, often characterized by colorful artwork, vibrant characters, and fantastical themes.

subcategories.name: Cartography
subcategories.description: Artistic representation of geographical features and locations, often combining elements of science and design.

subcategories.name: Vector Art
subcategories.description: Artistic technique that uses mathematical equations to create shapes and designs, often used in digital graphics and illustrations.

subcategories.name: Tile art
subcategories.description: Artistic technique involving the creation of patterns and designs using tiles or ceramic pieces, often found in decorative and architectural applications.

subcategories.name: Floral
subcategories.description: Artistic theme centered around flowers and plant life, often used in decorative arts, textiles, and botanical illustrations.

subcategories.name: Prehistoric
subcategories.description: Artistic representations and artifacts from prehistoric times, often depicting early human life, animals, and natural landscapes.

subcategories.name: Wonderland
subcategories.description: Artistic theme inspired by fantasy and imagination, often featuring whimsical and surreal elements reminiscent of a dreamlike world.

subcategories.name: Creepy
subcategories.description: Artistic style that evokes fear, unease, or discomfort, often using dark and eerie imagery.

subcategories.name: Mosaic
subcategories.description: Artistic technique involving the arrangement of small pieces of colored glass, stone, or other materials to create patterns and images.

subcategories.name: Pixel Art
subcategories.description: Artistic technique that uses pixelated images, often resembling old-school video game graphics.

subcategories.name: Sticker
subcategories.description: Artistic medium involving adhesive-backed designs, often used for decoration, communication, or graffiti art.

subcategories.name: App icon
subcategories.description: Artistic design used as an icon for mobile applications, often simplified and recognizable at small sizes.

subcategories.name: Geometric
subcategories.description: Artistic style characterized by the use of geometric shapes and patterns, often creating visually appealing and structured compositions.

subcategories.name: Manga
subcategories.description: Artistic style originating from Japan, characterized by its distinct visual style, storytelling techniques, and diverse genres.

subcategories.name: Ukiyo-e
subcategories.description: Traditional Japanese woodblock printing technique, often depicting scenes from everyday life, nature, and historical events.

subcategories.name: Paper Collage
subcategories.description: Artistic technique involving the use of paper or other materials to create collages, often exploring themes of composition and texture.

subcategories.name: Pastel Drawing
subcategories.description: Artistic technique using soft pastels to create drawings, often known for their soft, blendable colors and expressive qualities.

subcategories.name: Pan-African
subcategories.description: Artistic style and cultural movement celebrating African heritage and identity, often promoting unity and social justice.

subcategories.name: Graffiti Art
subcategories.description: Artistic expression through spray-painted or painted designs on walls and surfaces in public spaces, often conveying social or political messages.

subcategories.name: Art Deco
subcategories.description: Artistic style characterized by geometric shapes, bold colors, and decorative motifs, originating from the 1920s and 1930s.

subcategories.name: Cubism
subcategories.description: Artistic movement that depicts subjects from multiple perspectives, often using geometric shapes and fragmented forms.

subcategories.name: Purism
subcategories.description: Artistic movement emphasizing clarity, order, and simplicity, often using geometric shapes and industrial design influences.

subcategories.name: Pointilism
subcategories.description: Artistic technique using small, distinct dots of color to create images, often emphasizing optical mixing and color theory.

subcategories.name: Conceptual Art
subcategories.description: Artistic genre focused on the concept or idea behind the artwork, often challenging traditional notions of art and aesthetics.

subcategories.name: Photography
subcategories.description: Artistic medium capturing images using light-sensitive materials or digital sensors, often used for artistic expression, documentation, and communication.

subcategories.name: Miniature diorama
subcategories.description: Artistic technique creating small-scale models or scenes, often depicting detailed landscapes or narratives.

subcategories.name: Pencil Sketch
subcategories.description: Artistic technique using pencils to create drawings, often known for their fine lines, shading, and expressive qualities.

subcategories.name: Watercolor
subcategories.description: Artistic technique using water-based pigments to create paintings, often known for their translucent and fluid qualities.

subcategories.name: Oil Painting
subcategories.description: Artistic technique using oil-based pigments to create paintings, often characterized by rich colors and depth.

subcategories.name: 3D Animation
subcategories.description: Artistic technique creating animated sequences using three-dimensional models and environments.

subcategories.name: Anthropomorphic
subcategories.description: Artistic style depicting non-human creatures or objects with human characteristics or behaviors.

subcategories.name: Comic
subcategories.description: Artistic medium combining images and text to tell stories, often found in graphic novels, comic books, and strips.

subcategories.name: Cartoon
subcategories.description: Artistic style characterized by exaggerated features and simplified forms, often used in animation and humorous illustrations.

subcategories.name: Child Art
subcategories.description: Artistic creations made by children, often reflecting their imagination, emotions, and worldview.

subcategories.name: Coloring Book
subcategories.description: Artistic medium consisting of line drawings intended for coloring, often used for relaxation and creativity.

subcategories.name: Mythical
subcategories.description: Artistic theme centered around mythical creatures, legends, and folklore.

subcategories.name: Neon
subcategories.description: Artistic style using bright, fluorescent colors and lighting effects reminiscent of neon signs.

subcategories.name: Avatar
subcategories.description: Artistic representation or character used to identify oneself online, often customizable and stylized.

subcategories.name: Blog illustration
subcategories.description: Artistic images created to accompany and enhance blog posts, articles, or online content.

subcategories.name: Flat design
subcategories.description: Artistic style emphasizing simplicity and minimalism, often using clean lines, bright colors, and two-dimensional illustrations.

subcategories.name: Vector vignette
subcategories.description: Artistic technique creating decorative designs or illustrations using vector graphics software.

subcategories.name: Line sticker
subcategories.description: Artistic designs used as digital stickers, often created with bold lines and simple forms.

subcategories.name: Papercraft
subcategories.description: Artistic technique involving the construction of objects using paper or card, often used in crafts and model-making.

subcategories.name: Futuristic
subcategories.description: Artistic style depicting visions of the future, often characterized by advanced technology, sleek designs, and innovative concepts.

subcategories.name: 8K
subcategories.description: Artistic content created or displayed in ultra-high definition resolution, typically 8,000 pixels in width.

subcategories.name: 2D
subcategories.description: Artistic creations using two-dimensional techniques and media, often characterized by flat surfaces and limited depth.

subcategories.name: 3D
subcategories.description: Artistic creations using three-dimensional techniques and media, often characterized by depth and perspective.

subcategories.name: 8-bit
subcategories.description: Artistic style inspired by early video game graphics, characterized by simple, blocky visuals and limited color palettes.

subcategories.name: Splatter paint
subcategories.description: Artistic technique involving splashes and drips of paint, often creating dynamic and expressive compositions.

subcategories.name: Cybernetic
subcategories.description: Artistic theme combining organic and mechanical elements, often exploring themes of technology, augmentation, and human-machine interaction.

subcategories.name: Glow in the dark
subcategories.description: Artistic effect or technique creating designs that glow or fluoresce in the dark, often used for decorative and visual impact.

subcategories.name: Studio lightning
subcategories.description: Artistic technique using controlled lighting setups in a studio environment to enhance visual impact and clarity in photography and cinematography.

subcategories.name: Sharp focus
subcategories.description: Artistic technique emphasizing precise focus and clarity, often used in photography and visual media to highlight details.

subcategories.name: Macabre
subcategories.description: Artistic style focusing on themes of death, darkness, and the supernatural, often evoking feelings of unease and fascination.

subcategories.name: Ultra-sharp
subcategories.description: Artistic technique or style characterized by extreme sharpness and detail, often used in photography and digital imaging.

subcategories.name: Film noir
subcategories.description: Artistic genre characterized by dark and cynical themes, stark lighting contrasts, and a sense of mystery and tension.

subcategories.name: Disney
subcategories.description: Artistic style and brand associated with Walt Disney productions, characterized by whimsical characters, magical settings, and animated storytelling.

subcategories.name: Chibi
subcategories.description: Artistic style featuring exaggerated proportions and cute, childlike characters, often found in anime and manga.

subcategories.name: Portrait
subcategories.description: Artistic representation of a person, often focusing on capturing their likeness and personality.

subcategories.name: Soft illumination
subcategories.description: Artistic effect using soft and gentle lighting to create a subtle and relaxed atmosphere.

subcategories.name: Monochrome
subcategories.description: Artistic style using a single color or shades of a single color, often emphasizing contrast and texture.

subcategories.name: Emoji
subcategories.description: Artistic representations of facial expressions, objects, and symbols used in digital communication and messaging.

subcategories.name: Stained glass
subcategories.description: Artistic technique involving colored glass pieces joined together to form decorative windows, panels, or objects.

subcategories.name: Fluffy
subcategories.description: Artistic style emphasizing soft and fluffy textures, often used in illustrations and character designs.

subcategories.name: Logo
subcategories.description: Artistic design or symbol representing a brand, organization, or concept, often designed to be easily recognizable and memorable.

subcategories.name: Isometric
subcategories.description: Artistic technique creating three-dimensional objects and scenes using equal angles and proportions, often used in architectural and game design.

subcategories.name: Metallic
subcategories.description: Artistic style using metallic colors and textures, often to create a sense of shine, durability, or industrial aesthetics.

subcategories.name: Landscape
subcategories.description: Artistic representation of natural scenery, often emphasizing the beauty and majesty of the outdoors.

subcategories.name: Illustration
subcategories.description: Artistic interpretation or visual explanation of a concept, story, or idea, often created for books, magazines, or digital media.

subcategories.name: Poster
subcategories.description: Artistic design created for promotional or informational purposes, often featuring bold graphics and concise messaging.

subcategories.name: Close up
subcategories.description: Artistic composition focusing on a subject at close range, often revealing details and textures not visible from afar.

subcategories.name: Fish-eye view
subcategories.description: Artistic perspective that distorts the visual field to create a wide-angle effect, often exaggerating depth and curvature.

subcategories.name: Long angle
subcategories.description: Artistic perspective from a long distance or elevated viewpoint, often used to capture expansive scenes or emphasize height.

subcategories.name: Minimal line art
subcategories.description: Artistic style using simple lines and shapes to create compositions with minimal detail and complexity.

subcategories.name: Vintage postcard
subcategories.description: Artistic composition resembling the style and aesthetic of vintage postcards, often evoking nostalgia and historical charm.

subcategories.name: Studio shot
subcategories.description: Artistic composition created in a controlled studio environment, often using artificial lighting and carefully arranged props.

subcategories.name: Framed
subcategories.description: Artistic composition emphasizing the use of framing elements to highlight and define the subject within a confined space.

subcategories.name: Canvas
subcategories.description: Artistic composition created on a canvas surface, often using traditional painting techniques and materials.

subcategories.name: Sculpture
subcategories.description: Artistic creation of three-dimensional forms and shapes, often carved, molded, or assembled using various materials and techniques.

subcategories.name: Cave painting
subcategories.description: Artistic expression found in prehistoric caves, often depicting animals, humans, and symbolic patterns using natural pigments and materials.

subcategories.name: Drone shot
subcategories.description: Artistic perspective captured using unmanned aerial vehicles (drones), often providing unique viewpoints and aerial landscapes.

subcategories.name: Map
subcategories.description: Artistic representation of geographical features and locations, often combining accuracy with visual appeal.

subcategories.name: Vector line art
subcategories.description: Artistic style using vector graphics to create clean and precise lines, often used in digital illustrations and designs.

subcategories.name: Single line drawing
subcategories.description: Artistic technique creating drawings using a single continuous line, often emphasizing simplicity and fluidity.

name: Famous Artists
description: Renowned artists known for their significant contributions to art history

subcategories.name: Van Gogh
subcategories.description: Dutch post-impressionist painter known for his vivid use of color and expressive brushwork, including works like 'Starry Night'.

subcategories.name: Salvador Dali
subcategories.description: Spanish surrealist artist known for his bizarre and dreamlike paintings, such as 'The Persistence of Memory'.

subcategories.name: Claude Monet
subcategories.description: French impressionist painter known for his series of paintings capturing the effects of light and atmosphere, including 'Water Lilies'.

subcategories.name: Max Ernst
subcategories.description: German surrealist artist known for his innovative techniques and exploration of the subconscious mind, such as in 'The Elephant Celebes'.

subcategories.name: Picasso
subcategories.description: Spanish painter and sculptor known for co-founding the Cubist movement and creating iconic works like 'Guernica'.

subcategories.name: Frida Kahlo
subcategories.description: Mexican painter known for her self-portraits and depiction of Mexican culture, as seen in 'The Two Fridas'.

subcategories.name: Rene Magritte
subcategories.description: Belgian surrealist artist known for his thought-provoking images challenging perception and reality, such as 'The Son of Man'.

subcategories.name: Leibovitz
subcategories.description: American portrait photographer known for her iconic portraits of celebrities and cultural figures, including 'John Lennon and Yoko Ono'.

subcategories.name: Roy Liechtenstein
subcategories.description: American pop artist known for his comic strip-inspired artwork and use of Ben-Day dots, as seen in 'Whaam!' and 'Drowning Girl'.

subcategories.name: Yoshitaka Amano
subcategories.description: Japanese artist known for his distinct style and illustrations for 'Final Fantasy' games and his fantasy-themed artworks.

subcategories.name: Leonardo da Vinci
subcategories.description: Italian polymath known for his contributions to art, science, and engineering, including iconic works like the 'Mona Lisa' and 'The Last Supper'.

subcategories.name: Andy Warhol
subcategories.description: American artist and leading figure in the pop art movement known for his prints and paintings of celebrities and consumer culture, such as 'Campbell's Soup Cans'.

name: Gender
description: Categories related to gender representation in art

subcategories.name: Male
subcategories.description: Artistic representations and subjects related to male identity, characteristics, and roles.

subcategories.name: Female
subcategories.description: Artistic representations and subjects related to female identity, characteristics, and roles.

subcategories.name: Gender-neutral
subcategories.description: Artistic representations and subjects not specifically associated with male or female gender identities.

name: Object Types
description: Categories related to types of objects depicted in art

subcategories.name: Human
subcategories.description: Artistic representations of human beings, their forms, expressions, and interactions.

subcategories.name: Animal
subcategories.description: Artistic representations of animals, including pets, wildlife, and mythical creatures.

subcategories.name: Non-living
subcategories.description: Artistic representations of objects or entities that are not living organisms, such as vehicles, buildings, and inanimate objects.

subcategories.name: Nature
subcategories.description: Artistic representations of natural elements, landscapes, and environmental scenes.
